column4: Hey guys Ive known how to use and love using the man pages for command line tool usage syntax and such. But I just read online by accident that someone said to use man followed by the name of a system file rather than a command. Does this also apply to ubuntu man pages can tell you about certain system config files etc? If so, are probably all config files listed in man pages if you know? Im gonna have to experiment a bit if this is so.

many system files have man pages documenting their format etc. Often there will be a 'See Also' section at the end of a man page pointing you to other man entries. Also try 'man -k <keyword>' to find stuff..
wow thats awsome I never would have guessed that on my own. Hopefully that will come in useful. Thank you.
the thing about time-based releases is, you have to release, ready or not...
